item.title: Japanese knotweed, 2nd August
item.description:
A clump of Japanese knotweed is growing on the banks of the Pymmes Brook, about 100m along the footpath off Waterfall Road to the wooded area. Walk across the grass to the brook, you will see the Knotweed. It is a very invasive plant and will take over the whole area if not removed correctly, please will the council remove and dispose of it correctly. I spotted this 1 week ago. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Waterfall Walk, Brunswick Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: E bikes parked on pavement, 2nd August
item.description:

item.title: Fridge freezer and bins left on pavement, 2nd August
item.description:
Outside 83 Lyme road there is a fridge freezer which has been there for weeks. Both 83 and 85 Lyme Road always leave their bins on the pavement. The bins are often overflowing and also they often leave black bags beside their bins.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lyme Road, East Wickham, London

item.title: Abandoned Bike in front of second entrance to Smeaton Court, 2nd August
item.description:
These bikes have been locked onto railings right in front of the entrance making it hazardous when entering and exiting the building. Right in front of the pathway. They also seem to be abandoned as not moved for ages.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 50, Rockingham Street, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned armchair, 2nd August
item.description:
I'm writing to report yet another instance of fly-tipping in our area — this time involving an abandoned armchair. Despite the recent installation of CCTV, incidents like this continue to occur on a near-weekly basis.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Middleton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin constantly full and making surrounding road a mess, 2nd August
item.description:
This bin is too small and constantly full as it’s not emptied regularly enough. Surrounding road covered in rubbish as a result and especially at bus stop. A bigger bin is needed and more regular emptying.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 216, Tower Bridge Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: I large blue bag next to bin 1 small inside, 2nd August
item.description:
This bag is extremely heavy otherwise I’d have put it in the bin with the other. It’s very “wet” inside too. Haven’t opened to see what is in it but the smaller one (also heavy) that has been dumped in my bin looks like a lot of cut up aubergines.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dawson Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
